description:
As a Product Design Architect, you will contribute mechanical design knowledge with a focus on consumer products, advanced surfacing, and master model creation. You will be comfortable developing multiple internal component stack-ups, brainstorming new and innovative layouts, and solving unique mechanical challenges. You will report through the Design organization, working from early development through to hard tooling release. In this role, you will work closely with cross-functional Engineering teams and Product Management to define and deliver outstanding products. While being focused on technical aspects, you will be an advocate for maintaining the design intent through the build phases of a project.

Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Only one thing consistently stands in the way between our users and the world's information—hardware. Our Consumer Hardware team researches, designs, and develops new technologies and hardware to make our user's interaction with computing faster, more powerful, and seamless. Whether finding new ways to capture and sense the world around us, advancing form factors, or improving interaction methods, our Consumer Hardware team is making people's lives better through technology.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering, Product Design, Industrial Design, Manufacturing, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 10 years of experience in consumer product design. Experience in consumer electronics and mobile the industry.
  • Ability to travel internationally.
  • A portfolio of your work demonstrating your experience.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master's degree in Mechanical Engineering.
  • Experience with manufacturing processes (e.g., plastic injection-molding, sheet metal, extrusion, die casting, machining). Experience developing and shipping consumer hardware.
  • Expertise in parametric master model development (e.g., Creo, NX).
  • Understanding of mechanical design, manufacturing, and engineering requirements and constraints.
  • Track record with effective working relationships with Industrial Design (ID), Engineering, Manufacturing, Supply Chain, and external partners.
  • Track record of intuitive feel and judgment for design. Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with high attention to detail and a focus on the customer.
responsibilities:
• Collaborate with internal and external partners to make product vision a reality and establish innovative designs.
  • Deliver production-ready master models to Google Product Design Engineering. Work with ID and Engineering teams to troubleshoot manufacturing and engineering issues.
  • Work independently and as part of a team to execute with leadership through all product development phases. Travel to vendors and ensure design quality throughout the development and build process.
  • Present knowledge of new materials and processes, state-of-the-art innovation, and emerging technologies that inform product development. Identify future tools and processes to enhance capabilities and support company and/or department growth.
  • Ensure design quality throughout the development and build process. Ensure that solutions have development viability, are manufacturable, and hold the design vision intact.
title: Product Design Architect, Consumer Hardware
